com.cognifide.qa.bb.logging

Class TestEventCollectorImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cognifide.qa.bb.logging.TestEventCollectorImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TestEventCollector

    public class TestEventCollectorImpl
extends Object
implements TestEventCollector
    Central class in Bobcat's reporting API. Collects all test events so that it's possible to generate reports. Don't its methods manually. Bobcat provides you with several specialized classes that you should use instead.

    • Constructor Summary

      TestEventCollectorImpl()
      Constructs TestEventCollector.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TestEventCollectorImpl

        public TestEventCollectorImpl()
        Constructs TestEventCollector. Don't call it manually. Let Guice construct the instance and inject it instead.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start(String testName)
        Marks the start of the test. All subsequent entries will be associated with this test (called "current test"), until it's closed with "end" method.
        Specified by:
        start in interface TestEventCollector
        Parameters:
        testName - Meaningful name of the test.

      • exception

        public void exception(Throwable t)
        Stores an exception entry in the current test.
        Specified by:
        exception in interface TestEventCollector
        Parameters:
        t - The exception to be logged.

      • end

        public void end()
        Marks the current test as finished.
        Specified by:
        end in interface TestEventCollector

        Marks current test as failed.

        public void event(String action,
                  String param,

        Stores the web event entry in the current test.
        Parameters:
        action - event action
        param - event parameter
        duration - event duration

      • browserInfo

        public final void browserInfo()
        Retrieves browser info from webDriver instance and stores it in the current test. If the webDriver lacks capabilities, browserInfo will create an error entry.

      • startSubreport

        public void startSubreport(String subreport)
        Marks a beginning of a subreport in the current test.
        Parameters:
        subreport - Subreport name
